briefdescription.para: Shadow data.
Number of vertices.
Vertex size.
Vertex elements.
Vertex element hash.
Vertex element legacy bitmask.
Buffer locking state.
Lock start vertex.
Lock number of vertices.
Scratch buffer for fallback locking.
Dynamic flag.
Shadowed flag.
Discard lock flag. Used by OpenGL only.
Construct. Optionally force headless (no GPU-side buffer) operation.
Destruct.
Mark the buffer destroyed on graphics context destruction. May be a no-op depending on the API.
Recreate the buffer and restore data if applicable. May be a no-op depending on the API.
Release buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Enable shadowing in CPU memory. Shadowing is forced on if the graphics subsystem does not exist. BIND_AS_PROPERTY

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned vertexCount, const PODVector< VertexElement > &elements, bool dynamic=false)
memberdef.name: SetSize

briefdescription.para: Set size, vertex elements and dynamic mode. Previous data will be lost.
Set size and vertex elements and dynamic mode using legacy element bitmask. Previous data will be lost.
Set all data in the buffer.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *data, unsigned start, unsigned count, bool discard=false)
memberdef.name: SetDataRange

briefdescription.para: Set a data range in the buffer. Optionally discard data outside the range.
Lock the buffer for write-only editing. Return data pointer if successful. Optionally discard data outside the range.
Unlock the buffer and apply changes to the GPU buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Return whether CPU memory shadowing is enabled. BIND_AS_PROPERTY

briefdescription.para: Return whether is currently locked.

detaileddescription.para: Return vertex size in bytes. BIND_AS_PROPERTY

briefdescription.para: Return vertex element, or null if does not exist.

memberdef.argsstring: (VertexElementType type, VertexElementSemantic semantic, unsigned char index=0) const
memberdef.name: GetElement

briefdescription.para: Return vertex element with specific type, or null if does not exist.
Return whether has a specified element semantic.

memberdef.argsstring: (VertexElementType type, VertexElementSemantic semantic, unsigned char index=0) const
memberdef.name: HasElement

briefdescription.para: Return whether has an element semantic with specific type.
Return offset of a element within vertex, or M_MAX_UNSIGNED if does not exist.

memberdef.argsstring: (VertexElementType type, VertexElementSemantic semantic, unsigned char index=0) const
memberdef.name: GetElementOffset

briefdescription.para: Return offset of a element with specific type within vertex, or M_MAX_UNSIGNED if element does not exist.

detaileddescription.para: Return legacy vertex element mask. Note that both semantic and type must match the legacy element for a mask bit to be set. BIND_AS_PROPERTY

briefdescription.para: Return CPU memory shadow data.
Return shared array pointer to the CPU memory shadow data.
Return buffer hash for building vertex declarations. Used internally.

memberdef.argsstring: (const PODVector< VertexElement > &elements, VertexElementType type, VertexElementSemantic semantic, unsigned char index=0)
memberdef.name: GetElement

briefdescription.para: Return element with specified type and semantic from a vertex element list, or null if does not exist.

memberdef.argsstring: (const PODVector< VertexElement > &elements, VertexElementType type, VertexElementSemantic semantic, unsigned char index=0)
memberdef.name: HasElement

briefdescription.para: Return whether element list has a specified element type and semantic.

memberdef.argsstring: (const PODVector< VertexElement > &elements, VertexElementType type, VertexElementSemantic semantic, unsigned char index=0)
memberdef.name: GetElementOffset

briefdescription.para: Return element offset for specified type and semantic from a vertex element list, or M_MAX_UNSIGNED if does not exist.
Return a vertex element list from a legacy element bitmask.
Return vertex size from an element list.
Return vertex size for a legacy vertex element bitmask.
Update offsets of vertex elements.
Update offsets of vertex elements.
Create buffer.
Update the shadow data to the GPU buffer.
Map the GPU buffer into CPU memory. Not used on OpenGL.
Unmap the GPU buffer. Not used on OpenGL.
Hardware vertex buffer.
